author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
text:
Part of the proceeds from the concert will go towards post-flood rehabilitation —Photo: Noise and Grains

Thousands of music fans assembled at YMCA, Nandanam, on Saturday evening for ‘Nenje Ezhu’, music composer A.R. Rahman’s concert for the people of this State, and his beloved city.

And the Mozart of Madras didn't disappoint them: It was entertainment unlimited for these fans, as he presented songs that are an integral part of many a Chennaiite’s memories. Kickstarting the evening with Ella pugazhum Iraivanuke , the Oscar-winning music director went to present some of his superhit songs.

There was a generous offering for fans of Tamil music from the 90s – hits like Humma Humma and Mustafa Mustafa had the fans ecstatic.

And for those who tuned in later to the composer's works, there was a whole range of songs, including Ennodu Nee Irunthal and Thalli Pogathey . Popular singers including Hariharan, Srinivas, Karthik, Benny Dayal and Shwetha Mohan had the crowd on their feet, even as they presented a mix of melodious and foot-tapping numbers. 'Nenje Ezhu' will also be presented in Coimbatore on January 23. The Hindu is the associate sponsor for the event. Part of the proceeds from the concert will go towards post-flood rehabilitation.
title: Rahman casts his magic spell yet again
